index.name: go
index.subtitle: Go
index.about: Go is an open source programming language that makes it easy to build simple, reliable, and efficient software.
index.description: Watch screencasts over a list with the best free videos about Go language.

videos.title: Finding Memory Leaks in Go
videos.description: Go is prone to memory leaks just like with Java, Ruby, and other garbage-collected languages. Software Engineer Oleg Shaldybin from Apcera details methods for detecting, measuring the impact of, and eliminating leaks.

videos.title: A Tour of Cryptography Package in Go
videos.description: A system needs confidentiality, integrity, and authenticity to be secure. Kyle Isom (Software Engineer, Cloudflare) gives us a full tour of cryptography packages in Go with examples with hashing, random data, HMAC, and NaCl.

videos.title: Building Web Services in Go
videos.description: This talk is about Building Web Services in Go by Richard Crowley from Betable.

videos.title: The Nature of Constants in Go
videos.description: In this talk William Kennedy, managing partner at Ardan Studios and creator of Going Go Programming, dives into how Goâ€™s type system handles constants.

videos.title: Distributed Large Scale Systems in Go
videos.description: Building large-scale distributed systems is a challenge in any language: what about Go makes distributed system-building easier, what makes it harder, and what won't work at all? Former Google software engineer Ben Sigelman answers these questions in his talk about creating distributed systems in Go.

videos.title: Go at CoreOS
videos.description: At CoreOS, we chose to write everything in Go at a time when Python was the language of choice for Linux distributions. It had been almost 10 years since a new Linux distro was created. With the entrance of the cloud era, moving deeply into distributed computing based on Linux containers and multi-core machines, we needed a language that would allow our developers to iterate rapidly and create self-contained.

videos.title: HTTP/2 for Go
videos.description: Brad Fitzpatrick gives an overview of HTTP/2 (its design and advantages) and then discusses the design of Go's http2 package.

videos.title: Golang - Instalation
videos.description: This video demonstrates how to install the Go Programming Language (golang) onto a mac using homebrew in the terminal.

videos.title: Golang - Packages
videos.description: A simple rundown of packages in golang

videos.title: Golang - Remote Packages
videos.description: Describes using how to download a go repo hosted on github using the 'go get' command line tool and how to use it in a go application.

videos.title: Golang - Variables
videos.description: A brief rundown of go variable syntax

videos.title: Golang - Functions
videos.description: Basics of golang function syntax.

videos.title: Golang - Loops
videos.description: A byte-sized run down of loops in golang

videos.title: Golang - If statements
videos.description: A byte-sized rundown of if statements in golang.

videos.title: Golang - Switch statements
videos.description: A byte-sized rundown of switch statements in golang.

videos.title: Golang - Structs
videos.description: A byte-sized rundown of structs in golang.

videos.title: Golang - More Structs
videos.description: A byte-sized rundown of more struct syntax in golang.

videos.title: Golang - Methods
videos.description: A byte-sized rundown of methods in golang.

videos.title: Golang - Interfaces
videos.description: An oh so brief byte-sized rundown of interfaces in golang.

videos.title: Golang - Closure
videos.description: A (slightly bigger than) byte-sized rundown of closure in golang.

videos.title: Golang - Arrays
videos.description: A byte-sized rundown of arrays in golang.

videos.title: Golang - Slices
videos.description: A byte-sized rundown of slices in golang.

videos.title: Implementing a bignum calculator
videos.description: Rob Pike describes his interpreter for an APL-like calculator language.

videos.title: Underscore library for Go
videos.description: Toby presents his controversial Underscore library at golang-syd in July 2014.

videos.title: Writing, building, installing and testing Go code
videos.description: This screencast describes setting up a workspace (GOPATH), writing commands and packages, using the go tool to build and install, and using the testing package to write unit tests.

videos.title: Testing Techniques
videos.description: This talk was initially presented by Andrew Gerrand at Google I/O 2014 at the Go Developer Sandbox.

videos.title: Writing your own Go compiler
videos.description: In this video, it'll be explaining the Go potential as a very portable language and reviewing the Go tools that make that such an exciting possibility to write a Go compiler.

videos.title: Using Go for a simple HTTP Request
videos.description: How to do a simple HTTP Request using the net/http package in the Go standard library.

videos.title: Using Go to fetch and parse JSON
videos.description: Using Go to fetch JSON from a webservice, and then parse it.

videos.title: Concurrency with buffered channels
videos.description: Using Channels with Go for communicating with different parts of a concurrent app, and how a buffered channel provides a blocking feature.

videos.title: Watching multiple channels
videos.description: How to wait for multiple channels with Go.

videos.title: A Tour of Go
videos.description: Three things that make Go fast, fun, and productive for me: interfaces, reflection, and concurrency. Builds a toy web crawler to demonstrate these.

videos.title: Deploying Web Apps to Heroku
videos.description: Nate covers deploying web apps to Heroku using the heroku CLI and git.

videos.title: Getting Started with Go
videos.description: How to setup your environment and write a Hello World application using the Go programming language.

videos.title: Go Language Basics
videos.description: In this episode Jeremy covers the basics of variables, functions and loops in Go.

videos.title: Martini and Markdown
videos.description: In this episode Jeremy builds a simple Martini web application that parses and presents Markdown.

videos.title: Postgres: Basics
videos.description: In this episode Jeremy covers how to setup and connect to a Postgres database with Go.

videos.title: HTML Templates
videos.description: Jeremy makes his books output prettier by using Bootstrap and HTML Templates.

videos.title: Postgres: Inserting Data
videos.description: Jeremy continues with his Martini web application and adds the ability to insert book data into the database.

videos.title: Auth: Part 1
videos.description: Jeremy covers basic authentication with Martini.

videos.title: Auth: Part 2
videos.description: Jeremy covers basic authentication with Martini.

videos.title: Auth: Part 3
videos.description: Jeremy covers basic authentication with Martini.
